solution.text:
Cost of Plane ticket without VAT = Distance x Rate = (150 x 20) = Rs. 3000
Cost of plane ticket with VAT= Initial cost + \(\frac{VAT \,percentage \times initial\, cost}{100}\)
VAT percentage = _{j}_%.
Hence, cost of plane ticket with VAT = 3000 + \(\frac{_{j}_ \times 3000}{100}\) = Rs. _{{30*(100+j)}}_
Now, Since Shyam gets a frequent flyer discount, discount percentage = _{k}_%
Final cost for shyam = Cost of ticket - \(\frac{Discount \,percentage \times Cost\, of\, ticket}{100}\)
\( \Rightarrow \) Final cost of ticket = _{{30* (100+j)}}_ - \(\frac{_{k}_\times _{{30*(100+j)}}_}{100}\)= Rs. _{{(100-k)*(100+Decimal(j))*(3)/10}}_

content.text: Shyam bought a plane ticket ticket from Pune to Mumbai which are 150 Km apart. The ticket costs Rs.20 per Km + a VAT of _{j}_%. Shyam is a frequent flyer and the airlines offers him _{k}_% discount of every ticket he buys after all taxes are added. How much does the plane ticket from Mumbai to Pune cost Shyam ?
